Package edu.ncsu.csc216.business.model.stakeholders

Class PropertyManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.business.model.stakeholders.PropertyManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Landlord
    public class PropertyManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Landlord
    This class follows the Singleton pattern which is "implemented through a private constructor and the method ProjectManager.getInstance(), which returns the only instance of ProjectManager." and the factory pattern which is "implemented through the method ProjectManager.addNewUnit() and the RentalUnit class hierarchy. The method creates a concrete RentalUnit according to the method’s parameters. Both RentalGUI and RentalReader call this method for RentalUnit creation." This class implements landlord and all of its methods, as well as methods not described in landlord including getInstance. addLeaseFromFile, and getUnitAtLocation.
    Author:
    Kaitlyn Gosline, Sanjana Cheerla

      • addNewClient

        public Client addNewClient​(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String id)
                    throws DuplicateClientException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new client with the given name and id to the client database.
        Specified by:
        addNewClient in interface Landlord
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the new client
        id - Unique id of the new client
        Returns:
        The new Client who was created and registered
        Throws:
        DuplicateClientException - if id of the new client matches one for an existing client.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null, empty (when trimmed), or contains any characters that are not blanks or not alphanumeric. Also throws IllegalArgumentException if the id is null, empty (when trimmed), or contains any characters that are non-alphanumeric or that don't belong to the set ['@', '#', '$'].

      • addNewUnit

        public RentalUnit addNewUnit​(java.lang.String kind,
                             java.lang.String location,
                             int capacity)
                      throws DuplicateRoomException
        Adds a new RentalUnit with the given parameters to the system.
        Specified by:
        addNewUnit in interface Landlord
        Parameters:
        kind - Type of RentalUnit (starts with 'O' for office, 'C' for conference room, 'H' for hotel suite)
        location - String of the form FF-RR, where FF is the floor, and RR is the room.
        capacity - Number of people the unit can accommodate on any single day
        Returns:
        The new RentalUnit that was created
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not describe a valid location and type
        DuplicateRoomException - if the floor and room match another rental unit already in the Landlord's property database

        public void addLeaseFromFile​(Client c,
                             int confNum,

                             java.time.LocalDate startDate,

                             int numOccupants)
        Adds a lease into the system with the provided information
        Parameters:
        c - client of the lease
        confNum - of the lease
        r - rental unit in the lease
        startDate - of the lease
        endDate - of the lease
        numOccupants - of the lease
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - there are any inconsistencies with the property manager’s current data

                              boolean inServiceFilter)
        Sets filters for rental units so that only those that match the filters are considered.
        Specified by:

        inServiceFilter - boolean for whether or not the rental units are in service

      • createLease

        public Lease createLease​(int clientIndex,
                         int propertyIndex,
                         java.time.LocalDate start,
                         int duration,
                         int occupants)
        Creates a new lease with information based on the given parameters.
        Specified by:
        createLease in interface Landlord
        Parameters:
        clientIndex - Index of the client in the Landlord's customer base
        propertyIndex - Index of the rental unit in the Landlord's filtered list of rental units
        start - Start date for the lease
        duration - Duration of the lease (units depending on rental unit type)
        occupants - Number of occupants the lease is for
        Returns:
        the created lease
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not constitute valid lease data

      • removeFromService

        public RentalUnit removeFromService​(int propertyIndex,
                                    java.time.LocalDate start)
        Cancels all leases for a rental unit on or after a particular date. The remaining leases should still be valid.
        Specified by:
        removeFromService in interface Landlord
        Parameters:
        propertyIndex - Index for the rental unit (subject to filtering)
        start - Date for starting cancellations
        Returns:
        the RentalUnit that was removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if propertyIndex is not a valid index for the rental units currently under consideration

      • closeRentalUnit

        public void closeRentalUnit​(int propertyIndex)
        Returns the rental unit at the given position to service. Does nothing if the rental unit is already in service or if the position does not correspond to any rental unit (subject to filtering).
        Specified by:
        closeRentalUnit in interface Landlord
        Parameters:
        propertyIndex - Position/index of the rental unit (subject to filtering)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if propertyIndex is not a valid index for the rental units currently under consideration

      • listClientLeases

        public java.lang.String[] listClientLeases​(int clientIndex)
        What are the leases for a particular client?
        Specified by:
        listClientLeases in interface Landlord
        Parameters:
        clientIndex - Index of the targeted client in the landlord's list of clients
        Returns:
        an array of strings in which each string describes a lease for the targeted client
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the clientIndex does not correspond to any client.

      • listRentalUnits

        public java.lang.String[] listRentalUnits()
        What are the rental units for this landlord? (Consider only the units that meet filters currently in place.)
        Specified by:
        listRentalUnits in interface Landlord
        Returns:
        an array of strings in which each string describes a rental unit that meets all filters in place. There are exactly as many strings in the array as there are such rental units.

        Returns:
